snippet: Small-business owners in New York said a City Council package of antismoking legislation would drive customers into the arms of bootleg distributors.
abstract: Bodega and convenience store owners in New York City argue that City Council's package of antismoking legislation, including a proposal to raise the minimum age to purchase cigarettes to 21, would drive customers into the arms of bootleg distributors.
lead_paragraph: Small-business owners in New York said a City Council package of antismoking legislation would drive customers into the arms of bootleg distributors.

headline.seo: Business Owners Take Aim At Proposed Antismoking Laws At Hearing
headline.main: Business Owners Take Aim at Proposed Smoking Laws
headline.print_headline: Business Owners Take Aim At Proposed Smoking Laws
